meanings.definition: In a manner expressing disapproval or disappointment.
meanings.sent1: She looked at him reproachfully when he broke her favorite mug.
meanings.sent2: She spoke reproachfully to her son after he forgot to do his homework.
meanings.sent3: He reproachfully pointed out the upside-down sticker on her laptop, causing her to laugh.
meanings.sent4: The dark clouds reproachfully hung over the city, warning of an impending storm.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's eyes bore into the student reproachfully, urging him to pay attention.

meanings.definition: With a tone of blame or censure.
meanings.sent1: The principal looked at the misbehaving students reproachfully.
meanings.sent2: She shook her head reproachfully at her friend's careless mistake.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed reproachfully after being scolded for knocking over a vase.
meanings.sent4: The old house stood reproachfully on the hill, its windows broken and walls crumbling.
meanings.sent5: The disappointed coach reproachfully watched his team lose the championship game.
